title: Prompt Engineering Techniques & Patterns — Module 2 Quiz

questions.question: Which prompt technique is illustrated by providing input-output examples before the actual ask?
questions.explanation: Few-shot includes demonstrations in the prompt to guide the model. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

questions.question: The phrase “Let’s think step by step” is most likely used in which technique?
questions.explanation: That phrase triggers the model to articulate reasoning steps (CoT). :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

questions.question: Which prompt starts by assigning a persona to the model?

options.text: Explain Earth’s rotation in simple terms.
You are a senior data scientist. Summarize neural networks.
Summarize neural networks in ten bullet points.
Provide two examples of neural-network types.

questions.explanation: This is role prompting — assigning a persona. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

questions.question: Which prompt technique is best when you want the model to reason through steps on a complex problem?
questions.explanation: CoT is intended for multi-step reasoning. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

questions.question: In which prompt would a ‘template’ placeholder most likely appear?

options.text: You are an expert historian. Describe {event} in {number} bullets.
List three causes of climate change.
From now on act as a lawyer.

questions.explanation: The placeholder {event} and {number} denote a prompt template format.
